definition: to obliterate completely/to vanish from the face of the earth
to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive

sentences.english: His tearfulness about her fate had already diminished.
sentences.chinese: 他憐憫她命運的情愫早已經蕩然無存了。

sentences.english: And then the earthquake struck, and this swampy rain forest was gone.
sentences.chinese: 後來，發生的那場地震讓這片沼澤雨林蕩然無存。

sentences.english: Yet these advantages could all be frittered away if the nation were to close its borders.
sentences.chinese: 如果我們閉關鎖國，排斥移民，這些優勢將蕩然無存。

sentences.english: The recent glamping trend has taken the fun and adventure out of camping.
sentences.chinese: 近來出現的豪華露營潮流使露營的冒險樂趣蕩然無存。

sentences.english: In a few moments her beauty had vanished forever.
sentences.chinese: 頃刻之間，她的美貌蕩然無存。

sentences.english: In Southern Sudan, after decades of civil war, infrastructure is virtually non-existent.
sentences.chinese: 數十年的內戰使南蘇丹的基礎設施已經蕩然無存。

sentences.english: Homes and communities have been destroyed even several kilometres from the coastline.
sentences.chinese: 海岸幾公里之內，家園和社區蕩然無存。

sentences.english: Aches in your joints and muscles eases up after a session in a sauna shower.
sentences.chinese: 經過一次桑拿，關節和肌肉的疼痛就蕩然無存了。

sentences.english: Trust in the efficiency and liquidity of the market has collapsed.
sentences.chinese: 對於市場效率及流動性的信任已蕩然無存。

sentences.english: Joe the lotus building is ten, the fine makeup has been all gone.
sentences.chinese: 喬蓮房拾頭，精緻的妝容已蕩然無存。

sentences.english: A wonderful phrase ―one that has almost been lost in our culture.
sentences.chinese: 然而這個字眼兒在我們的文化中幾乎已經蕩然無存。

sentences.english: Even, the streams were now lifeless, for all the fish died.
sentences.chinese: 此刻連溪水中的生命也蕩然無存，所有的魚都死了。
